alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 15 at 2:53PM CST until February 16 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions possible late Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon over portions of the Rio Grande, Winter Garden, and southern Edwards Plateau.. A cold front will move across the area early Thursday morning with gusty northerly wind behind the front. Expect north winds from 15 to 20 mph, with gusts to 35 mph. Dry to critically dry fuels in combination with minimum humidity in the teens and gusty wind, may create critical fire weather conditions. People in these regions should avoid any activities that could inadvertently lead to the ignition and spread of wildfires during this time. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE, THE WINTER GARDEN, AND SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU ... * WINDS...North 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Atascosa; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
